VirtualFile.Name: eqclient.ini
VirtualFile.Description: eqclient.ini stores your video, sound and other settings. This Virtual File allows different eqclient.ini files per Character.

VirtualFile.Name: eqlsPlayerData.ini
VirtualFile.Description: eqlsPlayerData.ini stores your EverQuest account names. This Virtual File allows different eqlsPlayerData.ini files per Character.

WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features stacked windows with no border, the size of the full screen, on \\.\DISPLAY1. Swapping disabled. Leaves space for the Windows taskbar. This style is great in conjunction with Video FX to see parts of, or all of, the other windows.

RelayGroup.Name: AssistMain
RelayGroup.Description: Members will /assist main instead of the isb assist

RelayGroup.Name: FeatherHorn
RelayGroup.Description: Owners of the Unified Phoenix Feather and the Miniature Horn of Unity

KeyMap.Name: 000: - HOTKEYS
KeyMap.Description: Real buttons being pressed on the keyboard or mouse

MappedKey.Name: Ability: Fish
MappedKey.Description: Fish via HB11:10

MappedKey.Name: Ability: Forage
MappedKey.Description: Forage via HB11:11

MappedKey.Name: Clicky: FeatherHorn
MappedKey.Description:
clunky mechanism to achieve a Feather and Horn rotation
- add characters to the FeatherHorn ATG to enable participation - used in slot order to a union of FeatherHorn + CurrentBoxes, then advances everyone forward a step. all feathers go first, then horns. - step advancement is held 33s to avoid wasted clicks - a 600s timer resets all back to step 1, even if some clicks aren't used
ToDo: figure out how to more gracefully recover from a misfire. ISB assumes success, but it's possible that the keystroke did nothing because the EQ character was stunned or casting a spell, and didn't actually click the item.

MappedKey.Name: Combat: 1
MappedKey.Description:
this starts doing things to the mob on target after characters are assisting
shm: malo, slow wiz: eradicate magic, lower element bard: stopsong, epic/fe enc: tash, slow

MappedKey.Name: Combat: 2
MappedKey.Description:
adps
shm: epic, roar, start heals brd: bp, qt, etc..

MappedKey.Name: Combat: 3
MappedKey.Description:
moar dots
shm - dot social brd - cacophony, bladed song enc - dot social

MappedKey.Name: Combat: 4
MappedKey.Description: shm - heals and dots brd - melody

MappedKey.Name: Combat: AFK Invis
MappedKey.Description: stopsong + invis

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist
MappedKey.Description:
combat initiation
a two step process 1: Assist the ISB driver (or EQ MA) depending on ATG membership Assist Reset (resets things back to 1 after a mob dies)
EQ automagically stops attacking when the target dies, but ISB has no way to know this. we reset attack off state to off, avoiding a confusion on the next fight
reset MeleeAttack back to 1, move things like offensive stuff and burns back to 1

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Burn Rotation
MappedKey.Description: pal - Z multibind wiz - Z multibind brd - bellow

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Burns
MappedKey.Description:
activate big burns and discs
pal - Valorous Rage, Pureforge wiz - ITC, frenzied devastation shm - rabid bear, fleeting spirit brd - flurry notes, frenzied kicks (dirge still manual) enc - ITC, Calculated Insanity

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Debuffs - AE
MappedKey.Description: shm - ae malo and slow

MappedKey.Name: Combat: DPS Rotation
MappedKey.Description: pal - X multibind wiz - X multibind brd - pet swarm

MappedKey.Name: Combat: MeleeAttack
MappedKey.Description: turn on auto attack for CurrentBoxes also in Melee ATG

MappedKey.Name: Combat: MeleeAttack - Alternate
MappedKey.Description: Generated by Mapped Key Wizard with 'Alternate Hotkey'. The 'Hold' option is used here to retain the original Hotkey's behavior for when it is Pressed and Released.

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Offensives
MappedKey.Description:
smaller burns
ALL - spire pal - inquisitor judgement wiz - arcane destruction, arcane fury, fury of the gods bard - cacophony, bladed song, dance of blades

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Reset
MappedKey.Description:
when a mob dies, this hotkey can stop all activity
turn off attack, brd double invis, /pet back reset offensives back to 1 (ToDo: redundant here, if the next assist will do that anyway?)
forage

MappedKey.Name: Combat: SaveUs
MappedKey.Description:
initial ideas on easy ways to keep the group alive with a single keypress
if one remembers to use it before it's too late

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Shout/Bellow
MappedKey.Description: brd - execute vainglorious shout / boastful bellow

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Snare
MappedKey.Description: wiz snare

MappedKey.Name: Control: Show Menus
MappedKey.Description: a simple toggle to turn menus on and off with a single keypress

MappedKey.Name: Control: VFX-Toggle
MappedKey.Description: Toggle active VFX

MappedKey.Name: Invisibility: Selo - Clouding
MappedKey.Description: brd selo + double invis

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Others Back Up
MappedKey.Description: Break auto follow by instruction all other characters to back up

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Others Follow
MappedKey.Description:
any slot can be the leader
follow the slot that hits this button

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Others Sit-Stand
MappedKey.Description: sit down, stand up, sit down, stand up

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Sit-Stand: Self
MappedKey.Description: sit down, stand up, sit down, stand up

MappedKey.Name: Use this Key Map for custom Hotkeys!

KeyMap.Name: 010: - SESSIONS TEMPLATE
KeyMap.Description: SESSIONS TEMPLATE virtualized on the CHARACTER SET

MappedKey.Name: Control: Focus Slot
MappedKey.Description:
Focus Slot is called when switching to a slot Focus Slot XX can be enabled and used if a slot needs something custom
sets slot as MA and the Assist/Follow target loads healing/buffing clickbar, if SHM is active rotates VFX viewers, if active

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Others Back Up
MappedKey.Description: called from hotkey in 000 - HOTKEYS Key Map

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Others Follow
MappedKey.Description: called from Movement: Follow hotkey in 000 - HOTKEYS Key Map

KeyMap.Name: 010: 05 Box
KeyMap.Description: 010: 05 Box is virtualized at the CHARACTER SET

KeyMap.Name: 100: - CHARACTER TEMPLATE
KeyMap.Description:
CHARACTER TEMPLATE is virtualized on the CHARACTER
this key map contains slot specific mapped keys

MappedKey.Name: Clicky: Chest
MappedKey.Description: /useitem 17

MappedKey.Name: Control: Activate Me
MappedKey.Description:
called on switch to a slot executed by 010: - SESSIONS TEMPLATE -> Focus Slot
virtualization actions that are sent to the _other_ active slots #1 - tells the others how to assist this slot #2 - tells the others how to target this slot #3 - tells the others how to follow this slot #4 - used by clickbar healing to target this slot

MappedKey.Name: Control: Activate Persona
MappedKey.Description:
Activate a Persona
virtualization placeholder

MappedKey.Name: Control: Activate Persona Default
MappedKey.Description:
Set the Default Persona
executed on Character Load/Reload virtualizes Activate Persona00 -> Activate Persona before execution

MappedKey.Name: Control: Activate Persona00
MappedKey.Description: the Default Persona

MappedKey.Name: Control: Activate Persona01
MappedKey.Description: 1st Alternate Persona / alt character

MappedKey.Name: Control: Activate Persona02
MappedKey.Description: 2nd Alternate Persona / alt character

MappedKey.Name: Control: Activate Persona03
MappedKey.Description: 3rd Alternate Persona / alt character

MappedKey.Name: Control: Load My ATGs
MappedKey.Description:
Load some default ATGs for a game slot
TODO: move FeatherHorn ATG stuff out of the default, to allow for alts that don't have them

MappedKey.Name: Control: Load My Group 1 Leader ATGs
MappedKey.Description: joins Group1-Leader ATG

MappedKey.Name: Control: Load My Group 1 Member ATGs
MappedKey.Description: joins Group1-Members ATG

MappedKey.Name: Control: Set Me as MA
MappedKey.Description:
2-step keystring action that sets this character as the group main assist
step 1 populates the clipboard with a command grouproles set charname 2
step 2 pastes the string into EQ with the Paste from Clipboard mapped key / + <step 1 string>

MappedKey.Name: Control: Set Me as MT
MappedKey.Description:
2-step keystring action that sets this character as the group main tank
step 1 populates the clipboard with a command grouproles set charname 1
step 2 pastes the string into EQ with the Paste from Clipboard mapped key / + <step 1 string>

MappedKey.Name: Control: Show Menus
MappedKey.Description: called from Control: Show Menus hotkey in 000 - HOTKEYS Key Map

MappedKey.Name: Control: Slot - Assist ISB
MappedKey.Description:
Set slot to assist via internal ISB by leaving the AssistMain ATG
this is the default behavior

MappedKey.Name: Control: Slot - Assist Main
MappedKey.Description: Set slot to /assist main by joining the AssistMain ATG

MappedKey.Name: Control: Slot - Disable
MappedKey.Description:
Game Slot Disable
deactivate default ATGs and disable 000-HOTKEYS keymap

MappedKey.Name: Control: Slot - Enable
MappedKey.Description:
Game Slot Enable
activate default ATGs and enable 000-HOTKEYS keymap

MappedKey.Name: Control: Unload My ATGs
MappedKey.Description:
drops default ATGs
TODO: FeatherHorn

MappedKey.Name: Control: Unload My Group 1 Member ATGs
Control: VFX - dxNothing
MappedKey.Description: generates slot specific dxNothing viewers and sources

MappedKey.Name: Control: VFX - Setup
MappedKey.Description:
Called by _Setup Menu Button 4, with target of CurrentBoxes
Will set up resolution specific VFX viewers and sources depending on modifiers used.
nomodifier default is 2560 shift - 2256 alt - 1920

MappedKey.Description:
Called by _Setup Menu Button 4, with target of CurrentBoxes

break follow by telling others to back up

100: SlotX is virtualized at the CHARACTER

keystroke command to target this character
be mindful of long character names and the 14-character limit when stuffing commands into EQ. /tar<sp>01234567<Enter>

KeyMap.Name: 110: - CLASS TEMPLATE
KeyMap.Description:
CLASS TEMPLATE is virtualized on the CHARACTER
- this contains CLASS specific mapped keys for a slot - the default virtualization is called by the mapped key executed when the CHARACTER loads - using an alt/persona will require a keymap virtualization step to keep this in sync with the alt/persona's class

MappedKey.Name: Ability: Fish
MappedKey.Description: execute fish social

MappedKey.Name: Ability: Forage
MappedKey.Description: execute forage social

MappedKey.Name: Clicky: FeatherHorn
MappedKey.Description:
multi-step mapped key. resets to step 1 10 minutes after first action
1. clicks feather, holds at this step for 32 seconds 2. clicks horn, holds at this step for 32 seconds 3. popup text to let us know we're wasting our time

MappedKey.Description: stopsong + invis

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Main
MappedKey.Description: for /assist main

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Reset
MappedKey.Description: reset small burns to step 1

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Burns
MappedKey.Description:
bigger burns
valorous rage pureforge

MappedKey.Name: Combat: DPS Rotation
MappedKey.Description: multibind spam

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Offensives
MappedKey.Description:
smaller burns
spire inquisitor's judgment

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Reset
MappedKey.Description: when combat ends, this resets our small burns back to step 1

MappedKey.Name: Combat: SaveUs
MappedKey.Description: when it hits the fan, this may help

MappedKey.Name: Ability: Fish
MappedKey.Description: execute fish social

MappedKey.Name: Ability: Forage
MappedKey.Description: execute forage social

MappedKey.Name: Clicky: FeatherHorn
MappedKey.Description:
multi-step mapped key. resets to step 1 10 minutes after first action
1. clicks feather, holds at this step for 32 seconds 2. clicks horn, holds at this step for 32 seconds 3. popup text to let us know we're wasting our time

MappedKey.Name: Combat: AFK Invis
MappedKey.Description: stopsong + invis

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Main
MappedKey.Description: for /assist main

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Reset
MappedKey.Description: reset small burns to step 1

MappedKey.Description:
bigger burns
valorous rage pureforge

smaller burns
spire inquisitor's judgment

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Reset
MappedKey.Description: when combat ends, this resets our small burns back to step 1

MappedKey.Name: Combat: SwarmPetsLeave
MappedKey.Description: executes /pet swarmleave

MappedKey.Description: execute fish social

MappedKey.Name: Combat: AFK Invis
MappedKey.Description: stopsong + invis

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Main
MappedKey.Description: for /assist main

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Aura
MappedKey.Description:
Pact of the Wolf
sent via keystring because HotBar 9 is not configured for keybind access

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Buff Union of Spirits Slot 1

MappedKeyAction.MappedKeyString: Combat: Buff Union of Spirits Slot 1
Combat: Buff Union of Spirits Slot 1

MappedKey.Name: Combat: ITC
MappedKey.Description:
called from _Unified02 button
calls ITC on WIZ/ENC, and Fleeting Spirit on SHM

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Preincarnation
MappedKey.Description:
Preincarnation
sent via keystring because HotBar 9 is not configured for keybind access

MappedKey.Name: Combat: SwarmPetsLeave
MappedKey.Description: executes /pet swarmleave

MappedKey.Name: Ability: Fish
MappedKey.Description: execute fish social

MappedKey.Name: Combat: AFK Invis
MappedKey.Description: stopsong + invis

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Main
MappedKey.Description: for /assist main

MappedKey.Name: Combat: ITC
MappedKey.Description:
called from _Unified02 button
calls ITC on WIZ/ENC, and Fleeting Spirit on SHM

MappedKey.Name: Combat: SwarmPetsLeave
MappedKey.Description: executes /pet swarmleave

KeyMap.Name: 199: AA
KeyMap.Description:
Common AA abilities shared among multiple classes
If a character doesn't have an ability directly bound to an EQ keybind for some reason (lack of hotbar space for infrequently used items, for example), it can be invoked directly via these mapped keys

MappedKey.Name: _Focus-Slot01
MappedKey.Description: testing OnSwitchTo in ISB2

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Main
MappedKey.Description: for /assist main

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist Me
MappedKey.Description:
Virtualization target
Activate Me populates this key when called from Focus Slot

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Attack Off
MappedKey.Description: send /attack off via keystroke action(s)

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Attack Off-Stopsong
MappedKey.Description: send /attack off and /stopsong via keystroke action(s), in 2 steps

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Attack On
MappedKey.Description: send /attack on via keystroke action(s)

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Pet Swarm
MappedKey.Description: send /pet swarm via keystroke action(s)

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Pet Swarmleave
MappedKey.Description: send /pet swarmleave, via keystroke action(s)

MappedKey.Name: Combat: xtar 01
MappedKey.Description:
send /xtar 1 via keystroke action(s)
called from the Unified Menu buttons

MappedKey.Name: Control: Assist the MA
MappedKey.Description:
Part of a Virtualization Chain that begins when a slot is activated
010 - SESSIONS TEMPLATE -> Focus XX (slot ID) becomes 010: 05 Box -> Focus XX which calls 100 - CHARACTER TEMPLATE -> Control: Activate Me which is virtualized to each character 100: Slot1 -> Control: Activate Me which does 3 things target "other CurrentBoxes" ATG, Virtualizes Assist the MA in 199: General to Control: Assist ME in 100: CHARACTER Keymap target "other CurrentBoxes" ATG, Virtualizes Target Me in 199: General to Control: Target Me in 100: CHARACTER Keymap target "CurrentBoxes" ATG, virtualizes "Target Slot X" in 199: General to Control: Target Me in 100: CHARACTER Keymap
now all 'other' characters will know how to target the MA, and assist the MA when requested via the Load Combat hotkey in 000 - HOTKEYS Key Map

MappedKey.Name: Control: Flush ATGs
MappedKey.Description: Instruct every slot to leave all non-permanent ATGs so that we may recreate a new group of characters

MappedKey.Name: Control: Flush Class ATGs
MappedKey.Description: leave all 16 Class ATGs

MappedKey.Name: Control: Flush Class Key Maps and ATGs
MappedKey.Description: disable all 16 class key maps and leave all class target groups

MappedKey.Name: Control: ISB-Reset
MappedKey.Description:
reset all group creation mapped keys and other bits back to step 1
invoked by Character Set load/reload, or _Setup menu button 1

MappedKey.Name: Control: Roles 01
MappedKey.Description:
called from _Setup button
sets the current window as group MA and MT

MappedKey.Name: Control: Setup-2560-05Box-dxN
MappedKey.Description: called upon character set load/reload

MappedKey.Name: Control: Setup-Init
MappedKey.Description:
this is typically executed via _Setup menu button, with no modifiers held
- Flush ATGs and Clear all VFX - Load default ATGs for each slot - call Setup-Leader mapped key -- the active screen joins the Leader ATG, all others join Member ATGs

MappedKey.Name: Control: Setup-Leader
MappedKey.Description:
Called in Step 2 of the Control: Setup mapped key
Loads group members into the appropriate Leader or Member ATGs

MappedKeyAction.MappedKeyString: Control: Load My Group 1 Leader ATGs
Control: Load My Group 1 Member ATGs

MappedKey.Name: Control: VFX - dxNothing-1mon
MappedKey.Description:
virtualizes dxNothing in the 100: SlotX key map for 1 monitor layout
manually called from _Setup menu button with SHIFT modifier
this sets up the last action of the onSwitchTo mapped key for a slot

MappedKey.Name: Control: VFX - dxNothing-2mon
MappedKey.Description:
virtualizes dxNothing in the 100: SlotX key map for 2 monitor layout
called from _Setup menu button with ALT modifier
this sets up the last action of the onSwitchTo mapped key for a slot

MappedKey.Name: Control: VFX - Setup 2560
MappedKey.Description:
called by VFX button from _Setup menu.
replaces Step 3 from the Control: Setup-X mapped key
TODO: configure button to default to 2560, but use modifiers for alternate resolutions? two buttons?

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Follow Me
MappedKey.Description:
Virtualization target
Activate Me populates this key when called from Focus Slot

MappedKey.Name: Movement: Others Follow
MappedKey.Description: we cannot follow while sitting, so we must /stand, either here or in the EQ social

KeyMap.Name: 199: Items
KeyMap.Description: A list of mapped keys with assorted /useitem commands

MappedKey.Name: Useitem Bag: 08
MappedKey.Description: /useitem 30

KeyMap.Name: 199: Keybinds
KeyMap.Description:
A list of Mapped Keys to activate EQ hotbar buttons
for sanity, the keystroke actions here should mirror the in-game keybinds for each hotbar

KeyMap.Name: 199: Spellcasting
KeyMap.Description: A list of Mapped Keys to cast spells via /cast or stop an in-progress cast/song

MappedKey.Name: SetHealingBarsStatusOnSwitch
MappedKey.Description:
executed when we switch to a slot from the Focus <slot#> mapped key
enabled when the shaman is involved in the group
this needs more work to be flexible, but will probably wait for isb2 which will be merging menus and click bars

MappedKey.Name: Combat: Assist
MappedKey.Description: Firescue17 default hotkey is \

MappedKey.Name: Load: Menu
MappedKey.Description: Firescue17 default hotkey is Tab

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Always On
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is to contain only Hotkeys that should never be toggled OFF. By default, this includes overall control mechanisms, such as toggling Broadcasting Mode, or toggling other Hotkeys.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Mouse Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for the mouse) from the current window to all others. It does not have a Hotkey by default.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from the current window to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Next window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the next window.

MappedKey.Name: Previous window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the previous window.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Chat Mode
MappedKey.Description: This Hotkey will temporarily enable a White List for Broadcasting Mode, in order to only broadcast certain buttons (e.g. to attack if needed) but not others (e.g. so you can type in chat in one window)

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Formations Menu
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to toggle the Formations Menu

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Base Hotkeys
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map contains general use Hotkeys, which can be toggled by default by Activate Maps (Shift+Alt+M). Most of the default Mapped Keys use Do Mapped Key Action to perform behaviors from another Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: All Jump
MappedKey.Description: Makes your other characters jump. Configure a Hotkey, such as Ctrl+Space, to try this out!

MappedKey.Name: Flying V Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Flying V aligns your characters in a V behind the active character

MappedKey.Name: Line Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Line formation aligns your characters in a line to the left and right of the active character.

MappedKey.Name: Star Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Star formation aligns your characters in all four directions around the leader (forward, backward, left and right). Works for up to 5 characters.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Left
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Right
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Face Toward Target
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Invite Team
MappedKey.Description: For World of Warcraft, this is configured by default to invite your configured Character Set. For other games, configure an Invite Team method in ISB42 - Party, and set it as the Active Method for your Character Set.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing (WoW)
MappedKey.Description: Jamba Addon provides a Follow Strobing feature, which attempts to keep re-following your Master (outside of combat) to help prevent or mitigate lost characters.

Step.Name: Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Custom Hotkeys
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map can contain your own custom Hotkeys, which can be toggled by default by Activate Maps (Shift+Alt+M).

MappedKey.Name: Use this Key Map for custom Hotkeys!

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Party
KeyMap.Description:
This Key Map is not toggled OFF by the Hotkeys toggle and is not intended to contain any Hotkeys! Use a Do Mapped Key Action to Window:Current to perform any of these Mapped Keys. (As in ISB42 - Base Hotkeys)
Contains different methods of Follow and Assist. Some games will only work with certain methods.
The Active Methods are set up in your Character Set under Virtual Mapped Keys!

MappedKeyAction.Text: Follow Me: No Follow Method Active!

MappedKey.Name: Follow Me (Follow FTL + Slot ID Modifier)

MappedKeyAction.Text: Assist Me: No Assist Method Active!

MappedKey.Name: Assist Me (Assist FTL + Slot ID Modifier)

MappedKeyAction.Text: Interact with Target: No Interact Method Active!

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target - Standard
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target - Face Target
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Auto-Interact with Target - Standard
MappedKey.Description: This is the same as Interact with Target - Standard with the exception of no auto-assist, and Click to Move is left enabled in WoW

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Toggles
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is not toggled OFF by the Hotkeys toggle and is not intended to contain any Hotkeys! Use a Do Mapped Key Action to Window:Current to perform any of these Mapped Keys. (As in ISB42 - Always On)

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat (current window)
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from the current window to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat (all windows)
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from all windows, to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Mouse Repeat (current window)
MappedKey.Description: This toggles Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for the mouse) from the current window to all others. It does not have a Hotkey by default.

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - WoW
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is not toggled OFF by the Hotkeys toggle and is not intended to contain any Hotkeys! Use a Do Mapped Key Action to Window:Current to perform any of these Mapped Keys. (As in ISB42 - Base Hotkeys and ISB42 - Party)

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move Off
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move off. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the Non-combat Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move On
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move on. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the Non-combat Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This tells the Jamba Addon to tell the other characters the current one is master.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe Off
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn off follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the Non-combat Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe On
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn on follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing.

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the Follow Me key under the Non-combat Key Map, and the JambaMaster key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the Follow Me key under the Non-combat Key Map, and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the Follow Me key under the Non-combat Key Map, the JambaMaster and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing
MappedKey.Description: Turns Jamba Follow Strobing on or off

MappedKey.Name: Target Me
MappedKey.Description: This is an FTL-based Target Me. It relies on an in-game /target macro per Character in order to target the right toon.

WoWMacroSet.Name: Quick Setup 42
WoWMacroSet.Description: This WoW Macro Set contains all of the macros generated by the Quick Setup Wizard from ISBoxer 42

WoWMacro.Name: FTLAssist
WoWMacro.Description: Assists a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFocus
WoWMacro.Description: Sets the Focus Target to a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.
Sets the Focus Target to a specific character's Target, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFollow
WoWMacro.Description: Auto-follows a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLTarget
WoWMacro.Description: Targets a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: InviteTeam
WoWMacro.Description: Invites up to 5 Slots in the current Character Set to party

WoWMacro.Name: CTMOn
WoWMacro.Description: Enables Click-to-Move. This is commonly used with Interact with Target to cause a Character to move toward its target.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaMaster
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to set this Character as its Master.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOn
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to enable its Auto-follow Strobing feature on this Character.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOff
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to disable Auto-follow Strobing.

Reloads the WoW interface. This will activate any ISBoxer WoW Macro changes made (after an Export while playing). If you want to use this, you will need either a Key Combination, or a /click button name!

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist FTL
VariableKeystroke.Description: If custom in-game /assist macros are available (RIFT and WoW), this keystroke can be combined with 'FTL Modifiers' to /assist a specific Character.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Main
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured to enable simply Assisting a pre-determined Main Character

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Slot 1
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Assist specific Characters, in order to Assist the Character in Slot 1, to enable easy per-Slot assisting.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Slot 2
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Assist specific Characters, in order to Assist the Character in Slot 2, to enable easy per-Slot assisting.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Slot 3
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Assist specific Characters, in order to Assist the Character in Slot 3, to enable easy per-Slot assisting.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Slot 4
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Assist specific Characters, in order to Assist the Character in Slot 4, to enable easy per-Slot assisting.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Slot 5
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Assist specific Characters, in order to Assist the Character in Slot 5, to enable easy per-Slot assisting.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Slot 6
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Assist specific Characters, in order to Assist the Character in Slot 6, to enable easy per-Slot assisting.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select his target's target, such as to assist in combat against the same enemy. Most games include this feature.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Focus my Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Focus is a secondary target available in some games, to remain 'focused' on a target while still being able to click or otherwise select others.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow FTL
VariableKeystroke.Description: If custom in-game /follow macros are available (RIFT and WoW), this keystroke can be combined with 'FTL Modifiers' to /follow a specific Character.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Main
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured to enable simply Following a pre-determined Main Character

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Slot 1
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Follow specific Characters, in order to Follow the Character in Slot 1, to enable easy per-Slot following.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Slot 2
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Follow specific Characters, in order to Follow the Character in Slot 2, to enable easy per-Slot following.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Slot 3
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Follow specific Characters, in order to Follow the Character in Slot 3, to enable easy per-Slot following.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Slot 4
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Follow specific Characters, in order to Follow the Character in Slot 4, to enable easy per-Slot following.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Slot 5
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Follow specific Characters, in order to Follow the Character in Slot 5, to enable easy per-Slot following.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Slot 6
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured for games that can directly Follow specific Characters, in order to Follow the Character in Slot 6, to enable easy per-Slot following.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Most MMORPGs include an Auto-Follow feature, which is useful to move your characters together as a group.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Interact with Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: While most MMORPGs require actually clicking with the mouse to perform the default 'right click' action, others including World of Warcraft provide a configurable Hotkey for the same capability.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Invite (Accept Invite)
VariableKeystroke.Description: sends CTRL+F4 to an EQ client, which executes an /invite social to accept a group invite

VariableKeystroke.Name: Invite (Decline Invite)
VariableKeystroke.Description: sends CTRL+F5 to an EQ client, which executes a /disband social to decline a group invite

VariableKeystroke.Name: Invite (Send Invite)
VariableKeystroke.Description: sends CTRL+F3 to an EQ client, which executes a social to invite up to 5 other characters

VariableKeystroke.Name: Invite Team
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured to complete set up of the 'Invite Team' Mapped Key.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Jump
VariableKeystroke.Description: Makes the character jump. (May require HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Backward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character backward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Forward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character forward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character left. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character right. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target FTL
VariableKeystroke.Description: If custom in-game /target macros are available (RIFT and WoW), this keystroke can be combined with 'FTL Modifiers' to /target a specific Character.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Party Leader
VariableKeystroke.Description: If the game provides a key binding for targeting the Party Leader directly, this can be used to enable easily Following/Assisting the Party Leader

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Self
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select himself.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 1
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 1, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 2
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 2, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 3
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 3, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 4
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 4, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 5
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 5, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 6
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 6, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target: F1: Self
VariableKeystroke.Description: firescue17 Variable Keystroke

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target: F2
VariableKeystroke.Description: firescue17 Variable Keystroke

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target: F3
VariableKeystroke.Description: firescue17 Variable Keystroke

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target: F4

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character counter-clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)
